tool.name: SAGA.grid_calculus.15
tool.description: Gradient Vector from Cartesian to Polar Coordinates
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayDX False isArrayDY False output_data_DIR $output_data_DIR output_data_LEN $output_data_LEN name SAGA.grid_calculus.15 DX $DX DY $DY UNITS $UNITS SYSTEM $SYSTEM SYSTEM_ZERO $SYSTEM_ZERO SYSTEM_ORIENT $SYSTEM_ORIENT prefer $prefer response $response outputType_DIR $OutputSection_DIR.outputType_DIR transmissionMode_DIR $OutputSection_DIR.transmissionMode_DIR outputType_LEN $OutputSection_LEN.outputType_LEN transmissionMode_LEN $OutputSection_LEN.transmissionMode_LEN

param.name: DX
param.label: X Component
param.help: X Component The following data types are allowed in the txt file: tiff, x-ogc-aaigrid, png, x-ogc-envi

param.name: DY
param.label: Y Component
param.help: Y Component The following data types are allowed in the txt file: tiff, x-ogc-aaigrid, png, x-ogc-envi

param.name: SYSTEM_ZERO
param.label: User defined Zero Direction
param.help: given in degree clockwise from North direction

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_DIR
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format and the output value

section.name: OutputSection_LEN
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format and the output value

tool.help: Converts gradient vector from directional components (Cartesian) to polar coordinates (direction or aspect angle and length or tangens of slope).<br/>The tool supports three conventions on how to measure and output the angle of direction:<br/>(a) mathematical: direction angle is zero in East direction and the angle increases counterclockwise<br/>(b) geographical: direction angle is zero in North direction and the angle increases clockwise<br/>(c) zero direction and orientation are user defined<br/>
